data.current_description: Deletes the topic with the given name. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the topic does not exist. After a topic is deleted, a new topic may be created with the same name; this is an entirely new topic with none of the old configuration or subscriptions. Existing subscriptions to this topic are not deleted, but their `topic` field is set to `_deleted-topic_`.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete a topic and handle existing subscriptions
data.description_suggestion: Deletes the specified topic. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the topic does not exist. After deletion, a new topic with the same name can be created as an entirely new resource with no prior configuration or subscriptions. Important: Existing subscriptions attached to this topic are not deleted; their `topic` field is set to `_deleted-topic_` to indicate the topic no longer exists. This operation has permanent side effects.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is comprehensive but could be clearer about the side effects on subscriptions and the permanent nature of the operation. Added explicit mention of side effects and clarified the subscription behavior for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description: Lists the names of the snapshots on this topic. Snapshots are used in [Seek](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/replay-overview) operations, which allow you to manage message acknowledgments in bulk. That is, you can set the acknowledgment state of messages in an existing subscription to the state captured by a snapshot.

Snapshots capture the acknowledgment state of messages and are used in Seek operations to manage message acknowledgments in bulk across subscriptions. Returns a paginated list of snapshot names and metadata. Supports pagination parameters to control result size and offset.

data.current_description: Adds one or more messages to the topic. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the topic does not exist.

data.current_description: Returns permissions that a caller has on the specified resource. If the resource does not exist, this will return an empty set of permissions, not a `NOT_FOUND` error. Note: This operation is designed to be used for building permission-aware UIs and command-line tools, not for authorization checking. This operation may "fail open" without warning.
data.summary_suggestion: Test IAM permissions on a schema
data.description_suggestion: Tests which permissions the caller has on the specified schema resource. Accepts a TestIamPermissionsRequest containing a list of permissions to check. Returns the subset of requested permissions that the caller possesses. If the resource does not exist, returns an empty set of permissions rather than a `NOT_FOUND` error. Designed for permission-aware UIs and tools, not for authorization enforcement.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks input details about TestIamPermissionsRequest and what the response contains. Improved version clarifies the request structure and response format for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'pubsub.projects.snapshots.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects. Missing summary. Description is verbose and could be more concise. Reorganized to lead with the action and immediate side effects, then provide context about snapshot reuse behavior. Clearer for AI agents to understand the operation's effects.

data.current_description: Removes an existing snapshot. Snapshots are used in [Seek] (https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/replay-overview) operations, which allow you to manage message acknowledgments in bulk. That is, you can set the acknowledgment state of messages in an existing subscription to the state captured by a snapshot. When the snapshot is deleted, all messages retained in the snapshot are immediately dropped. After a snapshot is deleted, a new one may be created with the same name, but the new one has no association with the old snapshot or its subscription, unless the same subscription is specified.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an existing snapshot. All messages retained in the snapshot are immediately dropped. After deletion, a new snapshot with the same name can be created, but it will have no association with the deleted snapshot or its original subscription unless the same subscription is specified. Snapshots are used in Seek operations to manage message acknowledgments in bulk.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose and could be more concise. Reorganized to lead with the action and immediate side effects, then provide context about snapshot reuse behavior. Clearer for AI agents to understand the operation's effects.

data.current_description: Acknowledges the messages associated with the `ack_ids` in the `AcknowledgeRequest`. The Pub/Sub system can remove the relevant messages from the subscription. Acknowledging a message whose ack deadline has expired may succeed, but such a message may be redelivered later. Acknowledging a message more than once will not result in an error.
data.description_suggestion: Acknowledges receipt of messages identified by their ack IDs, signaling to the Pub/Sub system that they can be removed from the subscription. Accepts an AcknowledgeRequest containing a list of ack IDs. Messages with expired ack deadlines may still be acknowledged but could be redelivered. Duplicate acknowledgments are idempotent and will not cause errors. Returns an empty response on success.

message: Operation 'pubsub.projects.subscriptions.detach' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is detailed but doesn't clarify the permanence of the operation or the return value. Enhanced version emphasizes irreversibility and explicitly states the empty response, helping AI agents understand the severity and finality of this operation.

data.current_description: Detaches a subscription from this topic. All messages retained in the subscription are dropped. Subsequent `Pull` and `StreamingPull` requests will return FAILED_PRECONDITION. If the subscription is a push subscription, pushes to the endpoint will stop.
data.description_suggestion: Detaches a subscription from its associated topic, permanently removing all retained messages and disabling message delivery. After detachment, Pull and StreamingPull requests will fail with FAILED_PRECONDITION error, and push delivery to configured endpoints will cease. This operation cannot be reversed. Returns an empty response on success.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is detailed but doesn't clarify the permanence of the operation or the return value. Enhanced version emphasizes irreversibility and explicitly states the empty response, helping AI agents understand the severity and finality of this operation.

message: Operation 'pubsub.projects.subscriptions.modifyAckDeadline' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description explains the use case well but lacks input/output clarity. data.current_description: Modifies the ack deadline for a specific message. This method is useful to indicate that more time is needed to process a message by the subscriber, or to make the message available for redelivery if the processing was interrupted. Note that this does not modify the subscription-level `ackDeadlineSeconds` used for subsequent messages.
data.summary_suggestion: Extend or adjust message acknowledgment deadline
data.description_suggestion: Modifies the acknowledgment deadline for specific messages identified by ack IDs, allowing subscribers to request additional processing time or trigger redelivery. Accepts a ModifyAckDeadlineRequest specifying the ack IDs and new deadline in seconds. This operation affects only the specified messages and does not change the subscription-level default ackDeadlineSeconds for future messages. Returns an empty response on success.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description explains the use case well but lacks input/output clarity. Improved version specifies the request schema, clarifies the scope of the modification, and explicitly states the empty response for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'pubsub.projects.subscriptions.modifyPushConfig' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is clear about functionality but lacks explicit input/output details. Enhanced version specifies the request schema, clarifies the conversion mechanism, and states the empty response return type for improved AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Modifies the `PushConfig` for a specified subscription. This may be used to change a push subscription to a pull one (signified by an empty `PushConfig`) or vice versa, or change the endpoint URL and other attributes of a push subscription. Messages will accumulate for delivery continuously through the call regardless of changes to the `PushConfig`.
data.description_suggestion: Modifies the push delivery configuration for a subscription, enabling conversion between push and pull delivery modes or updating push endpoint settings. Accepts a ModifyPushConfigRequest with the new PushConfig (empty PushConfig converts to pull mode). Messages continue to accumulate during the configuration change without interruption. Returns an empty response on success.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is clear about functionality but lacks explicit input/output details. Enhanced version specifies the request schema, clarifies the conversion mechanism, and states the empty response return type for improved AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Pulls messages from the server.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves messages from a subscription using pull delivery mode. Accepts a PullRequest specifying the subscription and maximum number of messages to retrieve. Returns a PullResponse containing the received messages with their ack IDs, allowing the subscriber to acknowledge receipt. This is the primary method for pull-based message consumption.

message: Operation 'pubsub.projects.subscriptions.seek' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is detailed but has formatting issues (broken link) and lacks clarity on the return value and the practical effect of seeking. Enhanced version fixes the link reference, clarifies the operation's effect on acknowledgment state, and explicitly states the empty response for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Seeks an existing subscription to a point in time or to a given snapshot, whichever is provided in the request. Snapshots are used in [Seek] (https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/replay-overview) operations, which allow you to manage message acknowledgments in bulk. That is, you can set the acknowledgment state of messages in an existing subscription to the state captured by a snapshot. Note that both the subscription and the snapshot must be on the same topic.
data.summary_suggestion: Seek subscription to snapshot or timestamp
data.description_suggestion: Seeks a subscription to a specific point in time or to a previously captured snapshot, enabling message replay and bulk acknowledgment state management. Accepts a SeekRequest specifying either a timestamp or snapshot ID (both must reference the same topic). This operation resets the subscription's message acknowledgment state to the specified point, allowing subscribers to reprocess messages. Returns an empty response on success.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is detailed but has formatting issues (broken link) and lacks clarity on the return value and the practical effect of seeking. Enhanced version fixes the link reference, clarifies the operation's effect on acknowledgment state, and explicitly states the empty response for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Deletes a schema.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a schema resource by name. Once deleted, the schema cannot be recovered. Any topics or subscriptions using this schema will no longer be able to validate messages against it. Returns an empty response on successful deletion.

message: Operation 'pubsub.projects.snapshots.create' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Description is thorough and covers error conditions, naming behavior, and expiration details. However, summary is missing. The description itself is comprehensive for AI agent interpretability, including all necessary context about inputs (subscription reference, optional name), outputs (Snapshot object with generated name), and side effects (error conditions based on state).

data.current_description: Creates a snapshot from the requested subscription. Snapshots are used in [Seek](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/replay-overview) operations, which allow you to manage message acknowledgments in bulk. That is, you can set the acknowledgment state of messages in an existing subscription to the state captured by a snapshot. If the snapshot already exists, returns `ALREADY_EXISTS`. If the requested subscription doesn't exist, returns `NOT_FOUND`. If the backlog in the subscription is too old -- and the resulting snapshot would expire in less than 1 hour -- then `FAILED_PRECONDITION` is returned. See also the `Snapshot.expire_time` field. If the name is not provided in the request, the server will assign a random name for this snapshot on the same project as the subscription, conforming to the [resource name format] (https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/pubsub-basics#resource_names). The generated name is populated in the returned Snapshot object. Note that for REST API requests, you must specify a name in the request.
data.reasoning: Description is thorough and covers error conditions, naming behavior, and expiration details. However, summary is missing. The description itself is comprehensive for AI agent interpretability, including all necessary context about inputs (subscription reference, optional name), outputs (Snapshot object with generated name), and side effects (error conditions based on state).
